Reviews.Title: “Very old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim P
Reviews.Content: Very old hotel that needs a renovation soon. Would no one recommend staying overthere. Only advantage is that you are close to the airport. But obviously, there are a lot of hotels which also have this advantage. Good to know : the elevator cannot be used between the hotel and the airport at night. It would have been nice that the receptionist would have informed us about that! We had to walk with our luggage quite far to reach the airport.

Reviews.Title: “It was tired and so was I.”
Reviews.Author: ASayre
Reviews.Content: Staying at an airport hotel is never much fun. Staying at this hotel wasn't painful but it reminded of the transient nature of airports. While the desk staff were pleasant, the rooms could have benefited from cosmetic care. Dining options are breakfast and dinner. Having to have lunch by way of a vending machine was horrible. I would have gone elsewhere had I the energy to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel right on rail line”
Reviews.Author: Kayakaddict Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff made this Grade B+ hotel a Grade A. My whole experience, from the airport shuttle, to registration and directions, was A-Plus. I was traveling during a family emergency, but once I discovered that the hotel is right on the rail link for Seattle attractions, AND has a pool for the grandkids ... I put it on my mental list for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Worn & Weary - Both in Appearance and Service”
Reviews.Author: shoeluv
Reviews.Content: Pros: On the cheap side. Free shuttle service. Located a stone's throw from Seatac Airport. Cons: Extremely worn property. Heating/Cooling units in rooms smell of mold & mildew. Inconsistent service. The Clarion Hotel Seattle Airport has seen better days. It is an extremely worn out property that lacks consistent maintenance and housekeeping (e.g. peeling paint, holes in walls, broken furniture, etc.). Having said that, it is also on the cheap side, so the old adage that "you get what you pay for" rings true here. Now, I've stayed in several different rooms on the property, including the suites. Unfortunately, everywhere you go there is a musty smell permeating. This is just one of those properties that has you thinking "ewww" everywhere you go. To make matters worse, the customer service here seems as tired and apathetic as the building. In fairness, it appears that the front desk is woefully short staffed for the amount of traffic they get from airport patrons. In the several trips I've made to this property, it appears there is only one employee per shift for check-ins, reservations, wake-up calls, phone lines and customer requests. The bottom line is that if you only need to spend one night near the airport, this hotel is tolerable. However, with numerous other hotels lining International Blvd., there are certainly better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent-barely”
Reviews.Author: actranslation
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to overnight to make an early morning flight during one of Seattle's worst snowstorms. Not a lot of choice, so I was happy to have a clean bed. The place is more a motel, very worn around the edges (faux woodgrain worn off the edges of furnishing, revealing the fine pressboard underneath), though clearly effort has been made to keep it clean. Staff at checkin were friendly in spite of the travel mayhem, and the bed was comfortable and clean. The restaurant offered only a "dinner buffet" for $14.95, with some of the sorriest looking food I've ever seen. It honestly looked like they were running out of food, and reheated whatever they could rustle up. No restaurants in walking distance. I couldn't bring myself to eat any of it, and opted for something from the vending machine and the emergency energy bar in my carryon--better food in the airport. The bathroom was a bit of a disaster, with a leak in the ceiling (a real hole) dripping into the tub. Looks like someone tried to patch it--with paint! It's probably from the shower upstairs, which, if it's anything like this one, gets water all over the floor, since the shower rod is not strong enough to hold up the shower curtain when it gets wet and has pulled out of the wall, bunching the curtain up in the middle. Grout failing, wallpaper stained, not a pretty site, but an obvious effort has been made to keep it clean. Internet free, extra charge for above 1024. Comfy bed, but lumpy pillows. There is a guest laundry, something I wish more upscale hotels would have (I still remember the night one of the kids was sick in the night, the hotel was happy to do sheets, but we had to wash jammies in the sink). Complimentary Wall St Journal, Fox News playing on the lobby TV.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but worn out”
Reviews.Author: Rogerl53
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to beat the location of this hotel as it is a nearly adjacent to the airport. Despite this closeness Seattle-Tacoma International it is quiet. The beds were superbly comfortable. Unfortunately, the hotel is showing its age. The furniture in both the rooms and lobby is chipping and peeling. The desk lamp in our room had been pried apart with a screwdriver. The TV remote (which we had to search for) looked like it had been chewed by a dog. There was some kind of dried gunk that had oozed down the back of the bathroom door. Clearly housekeeping needs some training. You can't really miss the flaws. The carpets need a thorough vacuuming along the edges. Indeed, the whole place looks like it needs a thorough scrubbing and a paint job. We've recently stayed in Clarion's elsewhere and this is the only one that we experienced that looked like this. The halls were cold, the heat in the room was nearly uncontrollable. This is really a hotel for somebody that is transiting between flights. It might be OK for one night, but I wouldn't recommend it even though the price is reasonable. I've seen this hotel rated at 3 and 4 stars. No way that.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is two star rating at best.”
Reviews.Author: LeConteCruiser
Reviews.Content: Room heaters are wall mounted with no thermostat so either running constantly, off or manually operated as needed. Our room had no hangers in it, the facial tissue box had one tissue in it when we arrived with no replacement.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent Location”
Reviews.Author: canadakel23
Reviews.Content: After all day travel from Belize and a late arrival this hotel was a good choice. Not having reservations we got a decent price at 1am, better than most in the area. The shuttle was quick and Tim at the front desk made checkin a breeze, with a few laughs thrown in. The room was clean and quiet,and a comfortable bed. Nothing fancy here but a good choice for airport layover.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Mary V
Reviews.Content: Great price with our military discount, the beds were comfortable and the pillows were great. I thought the rooms were clean and the staff super friendly - My husband and I stayed twice the week we visited. I will be staying again when we come back to Washington.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Michparis
Reviews.Content: Lower priced airport hotel, clean, quiet (back of hotel), decent restaurant, good business center anb really 4 minutes on foot to the over bridge leading to the airport. Hallways could be recarpeted, however for the price, every thing is great (the TV could be flatter, I do not care, I do not watch TV). Staff is friendly without being sugary, Wall street Journal is complimentary. Highly recommand.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Simbot
Reviews.Content: It was fine, the bed was pretty comfortable, it was clean. If you just need a basic place to sleep this one will do just fine. The TV is pretty small, and not a lot of channels. The price is right though, good value. It's one of the closest to the light rail, and the airport. No need to wait for a shuttle bus, just walk there if you don't have too much luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidTraveller98
Reviews.Content: I had low expectations for this place but I was suitably impressed. It's good value for money, the rooms are clean, the beds are super comfortable, and I had a great night's sleep. We only went in to the city once, and although it's a 30 min Skytrain ride away (which I wouldn't like to do regularly), the station is a minute's walk away. There are also restaurants nearby and plenty of other hotels with restaurants. We ate at the hotel restaurant and it was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I needed”
Reviews.Author: Gary C
Reviews.Content: It was right off 99, easy to find nice clean room with good pillows a/c an tv all those extras that make it easy in room coffee maker, iron and board plus shampoo, lotion and conditioner lots of towels not a standard at others

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: gcarter2009
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff and friendly service. Clean and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “DISASTROUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: EnviroGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a PIT!!! Front desk staff is so rude. My mom and I are in Seattle because of a flight delay, and I booked this hotel on hotwire. If I could do it over, I would have paid $50 more for a decent hotel. This place is gross. Website says transportation to local malls, and there is none. When I asked about it, both Abdi and Jose (front desk) were extremely rude and I would almost say hostile. At least 5+ ppl waiting at front desk, no organization, gross hotel…stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Iloveeatingout
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with spacious rooms very close to the airport. Nice pool area with hot tub. As usual with choice hotels, the hotel was very clean with all the expected services. Friendly front staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Nicely Updated”
Reviews.Author: T_and_M_travels2011
Reviews.Content: About the 4th time I have stayed here - Will stay again. Hotel was recently updated to current Choice Standards, carpet, paint, granite sink, etc. Staff was very helpful in correcting a reservation error made on my part. Note: There is a "real" restaurant rather than the usual breakfast buffet. Guests receive 15% off coupon for breakfast. Overall a pretty nice place to stay - very close to airport. Shuttle arrived very quickly when I called at 11:45pm, and was ready to take me back to the airport when I requested it in the morning. Iron worked, Coffee maker worked, air worked - no complaints Meets the needs of business traveler very well.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one night if you had to.”
Reviews.Author: stefnicole
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the location. It's just a 5 minute walk to the light rail station and a 10-15 minute walk to the airport terminal. Otherwise, the bed wasn't comfortable, the shower had weak pressure, and our AC unit didn't work. It took the maintenance man an hour to come over and fix it, and that was only after we complained a second time at the front desk. We actually stayed here twice (2 separate nights), and while the second night was better, we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: praxonline
Reviews.Content: While a transit from Seattle to Amsterdam I stayed at Clarion. Rooms are great, bathrooms are clean, modern and great. There are several vending machines near room aisles to help yourself for beverages anytime you need. Restaurant is excellent with a good spread varieties for breakfast and lunch. I was highly impressed. A gym and swimming pool was too enticing for me to participate but due to lack of time I could not use it. They provides a 24 hour free shuttle service from Airport to hotel and back immediately at request. Overall a great hotel for business / family / vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old furniture and dirty looking, but nice bed.”
Reviews.Author: Conniesue55
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this Clarion Hotel by Choice Hotels. My first time staying at a Clarion and it will be my last at this location. Old furniture with lot's of scratches, patches on the walls. The bathroom towels were very nice and also the bedding, that was the only nice thing about our room. Hotel restaurant was OK, there is a Denny's 1 block away and the Lite Rail is very close by. Use of the hotel computers was nice for printing out boarding passes and very close to Sea-Tac. Internet was very slow and hard to connect for some people.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: TKColeman
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about how this hotel would be, but since it was just a place to sleep between flights (we spent approximately 8 hours there), I figured we take the risk. When we arrived, via shuttle, at 11:30pm we were greeted by a nice woman who checked us in. We were able to get in to go to bed right away. The beds were very comfortable and plush and I went to sleep right away. The bathroom was clean and the shower was hot in the morning. We went to their resturant for breakfast on the 2nd floor before we left on our morning flight back home. It took us awhile to get seated, but other than that it was a nice experience. The amount of food per person was more than enough!

Reviews.Title: “Good rates with park n' fly”
Reviews.Author: TravelAngel75
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. The hotel rates were reasonable with the park n' fly feature. Bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. Good amenities like the pool and fitness gym. Service at the desk was professional and congenial.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly pleasant, convenient to SEA-TAC”
Reviews.Author: lester26
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be more convenient to the airport-- 24-hour shuttle is prompt; you could walk if necessary, it's so close. Our booking was last-minute (missed the last flight out) and we were very pleased with our choice. The room was large, comfortable, and clean. Yes, the air conditioner was noisy, and there were some cosmetic issues with the room-- marks on walls, worn carpet. But the bed was very comfy, with nice linens and duvet. The room was quiet. The toiletries and in-room coffee were quite acceptable. The service was fantastic. If you need to catch an early flight, in my experience you can't go wrong with the Clarion.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Megtremat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 345. Woke up in the middle of the night feeling something crawling on me. Got up and looked...bedbugs! It was so disgusting! They put me in another room at 4 a.m. but still could not sleep the rest of the night. In the morning the day manager did not appologize or even sympathize with me. She did tell me that they would inspect the room though and that they do preventive measures for this sort of thing, just before she started to ring my bill up. I told her that I was not going to pay for the room and she informed me that she knew that it might not have been very comfortable, but I had a sleep and park rate and she could not refund me the parking charge.Uncomfortabel is an UNDERSTATEMENT!!! I was shocked and horrified! I took my car to Thrifty Park and will never return to the Clarion.

Reviews.Title: “dimly lit, bad restaurant”
Reviews.Author: kmusicand05
Reviews.Content: Our bathroom barely had enough light to see your hand in front of your face, and the restaurant was horrible (but without a rental car and right near the airport, we had no choice).

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but clean”
Reviews.Author: teechur
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is old and musty-smelling in the hallways. Our room was clean. There is no free breakfast (unlike most Choice Hotels), but there is coffee in the room. There is a pool and jacuzzi. The hotel is pretty isolated from restaurants (only a Denny's nearby); however, they have someone manning a Clarion shuttle to and from the airport 24/7....the man was not busy and said he would take us a mile or two down the street where there were restaurants and shops. We had him take us to Dave's Diner (which we had found online). When we got to the diner, he gave us a business card and told us to call him when we were done & he would pick up up! This was great to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great service”
Reviews.Author: alpad
Reviews.Content: My dad forgot his watch when he stayed at the Clarion hotel. He'd already left town, and I was at the airport in Sea-Tac. I called the Clarion, and they had not only found the watch, but sent a shuttle to the airport to drop it off for me. That was completely going above and beyond my expectations. Thank you Clarion Hotel for the wonderful customer service. My dad and I really appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “pleased with the staff”
Reviews.Author: deenacarter1956
Reviews.Content: The hotel will very clean and quiet.The staff personal were helpful and pleasant. I will stay there next time I am in Seattle,and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Needs revamping”
Reviews.Author: sacral
Reviews.Content: Okayish hotel. Do not go with great expectations. Pros: Best part is close proximity to Seattle airport, okay service, free shuttle from airport to hotel and back, free parking, free wifi internet. Cons: Otherwise, old run-down look, definitely needs a new carpet, no complimentary breakfast. Again, hotel can improve its look if they invest in buying a new carpet for corridors and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel - no frills - close to airport - who can beat it?”
Reviews.Author: HankPUD
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler and stay at the Clarion every month and have done so for several years. I am a preferred customer and get an excellent rate as a result. No hotel or motel in the vicinity can match their price; only one or two are closer to the airport but at twice the price. The hotel is older but has a bed, hot water, a tub, a TV, and phone. It also has a pool, hot tub, and exercise room. Though dated, it has all the needs of a traveler. You could stay at the Hilton next door for twice the price but what would the people that pay your wages and expenses expect you to do? Even if you are not a business traveler it is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mjwmjw
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to meet the General Manager and he was so helpful and kind witht he questions I had. This was the first time I stayed at the Clarion Hotel and you bet I'll be back next time in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Airport Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clttravelor
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Not bad not dirty good location. Very close to airport. Good value and the room is basic. But if you are going to spend the night to catch a flight the next day I guess it works. I got a better deal checking in at the desk than I did on line which was nice. You do not get breakfast, they give a coupon for 15% either dinner or breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A great place close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: IslandFlipper
Reviews.Content: Don't believe all these 1 star reviews. First of all, do not expect a Radisson or Marriot style accommodations. But those hotels also cost twice as much. We have stayed at the Clarion 4 times now. It has become a yearly tradition to stay 1 night there and leave our car at the hotel every time we do our "yearly tropical trip" in January. The place is always clean, the restaurant is nothing to write home about, but its not bad, and the shuttle is VERY CONVENIENT. We've never had to wait for the shuttle for more than 10 minutes or so. Back to the rooms: They are nothing fancy, but they are quite large and always clean. As I said earlier, we have not been dissapointed with this hotel, and we are planning on using it for another night on next year's trip as well.

Reviews.Title: “Honest & helpful housekeepers”
Reviews.Author: AKJane8
Reviews.Content: We spent the night of June 26 at the Sea-tac Clarion. The next week as we were ready to fly back from Seattle, I realized I had left a pair of jeans and a sweater in the Clarion Hotel the week before. I called the hotel that morning and housekeeping had found my clothes and had them all in a plastic bag with our room number on it. I was relieved and very thankful that I was able to get them back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for airport”
Reviews.Author: damaSeattle
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly unpretentious hotel. Clean rooms and reasonable price. Small pool with spa. Front desk especially helpful. Prompt shuttle service to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a one night stopover.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinKiki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night to catch my flight the next day. The front desk staff was very friendly, and when I inquired about a show at another local hotel they offered the shuttle service. The room was passable for a one night stopover, particularly because the price is so cheap. The room was large with a queen bed, a love seat, a desk area, and a bathroom. The furnishings were clean and well-kept. The walls and carpet are worn and in need of some TLC. The bathtub faucet was leaking, and there was blue stuff on the wall (looked like soap). Overall, I would rate it as meh. For the price and a one night only stay - it's acceptable. For a vacation or romantic getaway, it's not.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wretched”
Reviews.Author: LER_9
Reviews.Content: Booked online coming and going from a trip out of state, which due to the ferry schedule here and my air travel times essentially required staying at the airport (or at least on the mainland). The first stay was okay... nothing too nice about it, but nothing ultra negative either. The second stay involved a 1:00 a.m. drunken fight in the hallway, hairs (other than my own) in the bed linens and bathroom, stains in the bathroom, and an overpowering scent of those cheap institutional disinfectants used in places such as schools and prisons. Also, the heater squeaked loudly. Had I not booked through Expedia, who are surely smart enough to have some clause which prevents me from any recompense, I would have gone to the front desk and demanded my money back and just tried my luck at another one of the dozens of hotels on the block. For what it's worth, the cabin attendants on my flight were like, "Oh No! Not the Clarion Sea-Tac!!!" They recommended the Radisson Gateway.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place to stay at the airport”
Reviews.Author: terracore
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, one of the ugliest hotels I’ve ever seen and does not look anything like their web page advertises, however ugly doesn’t keep you from sleeping at night. This is a good place to go if you want a cheap, mostly clean but dated room to stay in right at the Seattle airport. There was a little mold in the shower stall grout and a few mystery stains throughout the room, but I’m practically a germophobe and slept comfortably at night. The rooms were quiet but then again I think the hotel was mostly empty. Shuttle service was FAST, and the entire staff was friendly. The restaurant was one of the strangest looking places I’ve ever paid to eat in, but the food was surprisingly good and so was the value (for a hotel restaurant). The in-room heater was a little unusual (Setting 1 is highest heat, 10 is lowest heat, makes sense if set as an air conditioner though). The room didn’t smell at all and neither did the heater. I would stay here again if I needed a cheap room near the airport. A lot of the other people commented that the hotel needs a major facelift, but they’re probably not factoring in that would probably increase the room rates too. If you need a pretty place to stay, there is a Hilton right next door for a lot more money. When I booked the Clarion had lots of rooms in the $70-$80 range.

Reviews.Title: “Run far and fast AWAY from this place”
Reviews.Author: madmax61
Reviews.Content: The staff was rude to my 72 year old mother when she questioned needing a credit card to check in. Yes, I know this is common and I don't fault the policy...only the way the man at the desk spoke to her. He literally said: No Card, No Room and then he walked away. One of the beds was so broken down we literally crashed into each other all night long. The ceiling of our room had many many water spots and the hallways smelled musty. The bartender and the waitress were friendly and I did appreciate that. We were charged for safe we never used and when I questioned it I was told it was probably Just a tax!! I asked a couple of questions about where a reunion function would be held and was told I dont know, probably the lounge. The hotel does not even remotely ressemble the rooms I saw in the advertisements. Run far and fast from this place...you will thank me.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs major facelift, has indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: thirdshf
Reviews.Content: It looks tempting, but avoid this hotel. I made the mistake of being enticed by a low rate ($101/night) for a hotel brand that is supposed to be close to the top of the line for Choice Hotels properties. I've stayed in Econolodges, Red Roof Inns, and Motel 6s that were far better than this place. I arrived in Seattle around midnight, so we needed a nearby hotel that would pick us up at the airport. After picking up the luggage, I tried calling several times to arrange for a pickup by the hotel van. No answer and I kept getting routed back to the hotel's main voice mail menu when I made a selection. I finally gave up after trying for about 15 minutes and took a $10 cab ride to the hotel. When I mentioned it to the person at the reception desk, I got a "stuff happens" response. (This was a few minutes after he decided to end the personal call he was making when we arrived.) The rooms are small and the furnishings are seriously worn. The bed was acceptable. They've tried to put some window dressing on the public areas in a feeble attempt to spruce up this tired hotel, but there's only so much you can do with an amateurish paint job. There's no getting around it -- this is not a pretty place to stay. If you are looking at this hotel on its website, please note that the lobby doesn't look anything like it does in the photos that are posted there. If you're only looking for a place to plop your head for a few hours between flights, it's a slightly alternative to a sleeping bag on the floor of the airport, but not by much. The best part of my stay was greeting the guy from Enterprise Rent-A-Car who picked me up the morning after.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Close and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Realaloha
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night to catch early flight. Clean room, comfortable bed, and room service. Pool area clean and enjoyed by kids. Great shuttle service to and from airport. Nothing fancy about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the night!”
Reviews.Author: jla665
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a short night before an early flight. Paid less than 85.00 for the night including all taxes. Shuttle to and from the airport was very efficient. The room was clean and the bedding looked recently upgraded. Bed was comfortable. Check in was a breeze, and the desk agent was very nice and had a smile for everyone. Check out was the same, and no problem removing the safe fee from the bill. Left too early to have breakfast. The location is good, right across from the airport. Several restaurants were in walking distance. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Special Event Spoiled”
Reviews.Author: MamaJost
Reviews.Content: We live 45 min. drive away and chose this hotel for its indoor hotel and family room size. It was a Special Event Birthday Pool Party for my teenage daughter. I specifically requested a ground floor room near/close to pool area. We got a 3rd floor room farthest building from the pool. The pool spa didnt work. The pool rules had 3 different signs on what age for supervision. We had 2 girls at least 14 yrs and all good swimmers. We were told an adult needed to be accompanied at all times. I cannot believe a Clarion Hotel did NOT offer an Express or Continental Breakfast of ANY kind. Not even coffee in the lobby. Even Motel 6's have that for 1/2 the price!. The room service and restaurant prices were extremely high considering if you do not have transportation you have few options since there were no local advertisements in the room to order in. Check out was noon, but the maids were vacuuming at 8:30am. The hotel is in need of some updating. Old musty carpets and hallways have odors and old wallpapers. There wasn't a gift shop or a mini shop for beverages other than coin machines. We were very disappointed and dis satisfied on such a Special Event. We would recommend for any families, or quality length of stay. Short term over night and only if you have transportation.

Reviews.Title: “OK for short stop-over”
Reviews.Author: twiddle
Reviews.Content: This hotel room was booked through the website run by an airline travel agency as I needed a place to crash overnight during my 20-hour stopover on the way home from Japan. The cost of the night's stay was about US$85 plus tax. This is a fairly basic hotel so don't expect much. At that price, personally to me it seems a bit overpriced. Pro + free wireless connection + free 24-hour airport shuttle + friendly and helpful staff Con - rooms need better maintenance, both in terms of cleanliness and furnishings - walls are thin (or people are just loud), so bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper - value for the price is a bit lower than expected

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, Nice People, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: durf1
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we've stayed at this facility. Having read the many mixed reviews, we were somewhat apprehensive about staying prior to our first stay but decided to go ahead a book it because of a very good rate (senior 60 and over), the convenience, and because of airlined credits for Southwest Airlines. We did find that the bathroom could have been given more attention on our first stay, but other than that everything was fine. On our most recent stay we found the entire room to be very clean. In both cases, we had booked a queen but were given a king at the same price ($59 + tax). The front desk people were very friendly and helpful. In fact, on our second stay, my wife managed to leave her cosmetics in her hanging bag in the bathroom. Upon our return home, she contacted Karen at the Clarion who arranged to have the bag shipped to our home address. It arrived expeditiously. I did have one problem I addressed with the hotel both times we stayed which was a $1.50 a night charge for the use of the in-room safe which we didn't use. In both cases, the front desk girls almost embarrassingly told me it was an automatic additon to the bill and they were instructed to remove it upon request. Like myself, they did not feel comfortable with the hotel's practice in doing this. Anyway, if you stay here be watching for it. Other than that, I'd recommend this facility to anyone looking for lodging that is quite convenient to Sea-Tac and at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “adequate for a one nighter”
Reviews.Author: tropicsboy
Reviews.Content: Had a flight out of SeaTac and stayed here for one night Wasnt expecting much and surprise surprise. This place is not too bad at all. Although there is a like a stale smell in the room (non-smoking). And when I turned on the heater/AC in the room a funny smell came out of it, but this is an adequate hotel when you are there just to wait for your flight. Very friendly and pleasant staff. It is very close to SeaTAC and the complementary shuttle to the airport was responsive and efficient. I wouldnt recommend for a longer term stay though. But for a short stay while waiting to catch your flight, this place is a good budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Love them all”
Reviews.Author: dag2325
Reviews.Content: I found the Clarion above average from the rest of the hotels in the area! They are redoing the guest rooms, hallways etc. THe restaurant has great service and good food! I would go back and stay there again if I ever fly out of seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “I would have preferred to stay somewere else!”
Reviews.Author: AntiguaBlue
Reviews.Content: I spent one week here from August 18-25, 2007 and was supposed to have a king suite the entire time but on checking in they had my reservation incorrect and booked me into a standard king room (smoking). The room was dated and smelled like cigars. The next day they placed me in a no smoking king suite, the only difference is that it is larger and the microwave and mini fridge is in an area outside of the bedroom. This hotel is dated and the entire hallway area including the guest rooms has an odor like stale perfume. The beds are decent but the furnishings are old. You won’t find plasma televisions here. Housekeeping is done daily but prior to my last day I had to call three times to get housekeeping done. I noticed mold on the shower curtain and on the caulking on the tub. There is an indoor pool/spa unattended; I did not use it because the chlorine was over powering. A lounge is provided on the second floor but I did not go inside. If you rent or have a car drive west 1.5 miles to South Center parkway and make a left and you will find decent restaurants in the strip on your right. Travel north 12 miles and you get to the center of Seattle. Interstate 5 construction was finishing up so travel should not be a problem. If you need to stay here one night it should ok as a last resort especially if you want to catch a flight since the airport is five minuets from here but I would not recommend a stay longer than that. If you need to have a business meeting near the airport I would suggest another hotel. We had coffee & tea and pastry in the morning. Most mornings the pastry was stale and one morning I had to have the hotel make fresh coffee because it was so weak. The hotel made sandwiches for us for lunch and after having a few bites I threw it away and went out for lunch instead. If you are concerned with fire protection issues this hotel does not have a fire sprinkler system. Smoke detectors were in the rooms and common areas. The only reason I stayed here was because it was booked by another company I was doing contract work for as well as having a meeting here. A restaurant is located on the second floor and the food would be fair at best and their prices are not cheap. There are two Denny’s located north and south on International drive within a 10 minuet drive so if you want breakfast go there instead. Since there are other hotels in the area I would research them before opting to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Baxman
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was better than most of the other reviewers. For a sub $100 room it was not so bad. Don't get me wrong the place is not really nice either. Everything is adequate and considering the price that is not so bad. My room was clean and the bed was pretty comfortable. I only heard a few planes so I would say the room was quiet. The room had a couch, microwave and a refrigerator. The bathroom was clean. The room did smell heavily of room deordorizor. Cable channel selection was good. The room did look like it need to be updated and perhaps painted. You will not mistake this for a new or recently renovated hotel. The free airport shuttle service picking me up and dropping me off was quick and easy. Just call from the airport and they will come get you. The hotel is very close to the airport so you won't have to wait long. The staff was very nice. They are a plus for the hotel. There is an onsite restaurant which is good because other than a Denny's down the block there is not many places in this area to eat. The prices at the hotel restaurant were what you would find at any other restaurant. My breakfast was good and the service was good. Once again this hotel is not so bad for a cheap room. I would only recommend it for a quick stay before you leave for the airport. I missed my connection and had to stay overnight before I left in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “i luved it!”
Reviews.Author: dnthave1
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel on a skool trip frm northern ireland and ok it is a little bit old and needs 2 b cleaned bt the people are soooo nice and the receptionist wen and bought us stuff frm the shops!!! its a bed and some fod so i cant complain. it ws aawsome!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we'd been booked elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: leep1934
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Clarion Hotel at the Seattle airport was not a great experience. We have stayed at well over 100 hotels in the last 14 years since I retired, and this hotel was in the bottom 10 % and we are not spoiled by fancy, luxury hotels. The Clarion hotel had seen better days. The rooms (we had to be moved from one room to another because of a broken door lock) were shabby, a bedside table was sticky, the carpet was soiled and poorly vacuumed, the tables in the corridor were noticeably dusty, the room air conditioner was ancient, but did work adequately; our 2nd room was on a lower level and car tires and bumpers in the parking lot were our immediate view. In the hotel's favor, the staff tried its best and under difficult circumstances were of good cheer. We would not stay there again nor could we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Jumpshot
Reviews.Content: This is the worst we ever stayed in. The smell was unbearable and the carpet was filithy. The beds were every uncomforable. We do not recommend this hotel for even a one night layover stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Forgettable”
Reviews.Author: farlucy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not up to standards of other Clarion Hotels. It wasn't particularly clean and our room was below ground level offering a view of the undercarriage of several cars parked outside our window. I admit it's hard to find a decent, moderately-priced hotel at SeaTac, but this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Flashback to the 70's”
Reviews.Author: jkingspencer
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, if you are interested in staying close to the airport. Unfortunately, it appears that it hasn't been updated since the 70's. The carpets in hallways, as well as the rooms were very dirty. The hotel has a terrible smell - maybe smoke mixed with mildew. You can definitely do better for the money, in the same area. I was very disappointed, as I have had good luck with the Clarion chain in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it !!”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Woodward
Reviews.Content: We made the mistake of staying in this hotel, thankfully it was only for 6 hours. Knowing what I know now I should have slept in the airport waiting lounge, or on a local park bench! The bed was uncomfortable the noise was unbearable, a mix of the ancient air conditioning units rattling away in a neighbours room and the extractor fans from the restaurant. I sat on the couch and nearly fell through it, it was so worn. The bathroom was disgusting, the grout was filthy and wall around the mixer dial had collapsed into the wall cavity. If you have any other choice of accommodation take it, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would not have picked this place!”
Reviews.Author: takemeaway1127
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight when my flight was changed. The ceiling had stains, the carpet had not been cleaned, the only thing that put this above a basic one star hotel was the signature Clarion "glasses" as opposed to plastic... and decent shampoo...and that was not enough! I was in a room below a hallway ramp so had to carry by heavy bags up and down 4 steps to get into my room. My "basement" view was of the underside of a car's front bumper. The bottom of the tub must have been mildew stained so badly that a quickly cut piece of contact type paper had been stuck in the bottom of the tub to cover the stains. Sorry, I could not recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Best only to stay pre and post air flights”
Reviews.Author: Waneta
Reviews.Content: Clarion provides shuttle to and from airport. This hotel is sufficient for one night stays awaiting air flights. Nice dining area for breakfast. Rooms normal hotel size. Did experience the hot/cold shower thing though as did another reviewer. Nothing fancy here, but served our purpose. Budget minded may look into this but wouldnt suggest an extended stay. Not near many other sights, restaurants etc. Quite far from attractions in Seattle area. Just a good airport waiting spot.

Reviews.Title: “If The Price is Right.”
Reviews.Author: ganon
Reviews.Content: If The Price is Right is the title I give my reviews when the hotel has meet the basics of what I need as a business traveler but maybe has missed the mark in other ways. Therefore choose this hotel only if it is less then the competition in the SeaTac area Pros: All the features you expect from a 2 1/2 star hotel plus, free partking, refrigerator a free high speed access. Front desk very friendly and accomadating. Cons: The hotel is showing its age in carpeting and room decor. It might also expain the cycle of burning hot to ice cold water that would come out of the shower. The recycling pump seemed to have a mind of its own and is the number 1 reason I gave this hotel 2 stars. I dont want to experience that again.

Reviews.Title: “In a word.......FILTHY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel one night to catch an early flight next morning. Thank goodness it was only one night. If you don't mind REALLY dirty hallways and elevators, rooms that smelled like urine, and a pool closed due to dirty water (with band aids, food and hair caught in the drain), then you won't mind this hotel. If, however, you have any standards whatsoever, you will find this hotel unacceptable. Can't believe they are still in business with the condition it is in.

Reviews.Title: “very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on line for a king bed. When we arrived we were given a room with a full size bed and told our booking had been entered inthe computer wrong. My husband found this exceptable but I did not. I went to the lobby to be relocted into another room. The young woman helping me was very nice but insisted there were no rooms available. There was a young man assisting another couple that took the time to help her with my problem. The made a mutual discision to move us into a suite with a whirlpool tub and a king size bed. I found this to be very accomodating and appriciated the help and team work between the two of the to try and make our stay comfortable. Thank you Janice and Richard Gardner

Reviews.Title: “Quite awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My bet is that all TripAdvisor reviewers had that one horrid hotel experience that moved them to start submitting reviews, and for me that came courtesy of the Sea-Tac Clarion. Granted, I was in a last-minute hunt for affordable accommodation and the Clarion gave me a very reasonable rate. But I did drive out of my way expecting a decent hotel, and was terribly disappointed. The room was cramped and smelled like an old sock. It felt like a Days Inn or even a Motel 6. How they got the "Clarion" name is beyond me. I do have to compliment the staff, though. They were amazingly friendly and helpful, even in the middle of the night. Considering that this hotel seems to be heavily used by airlines for their frustrated passengers, that is especially welcome. If you need a place to crash immediately before or after your flight, this hotel might do in a pinch, but I am certain there are better options out there. If you don't need to be near the airport, steer clear of this area altogether.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place for a family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekand at the Clarion Hotel Seattle Airport. The staff was very freindly and I enjoyed the facilities. The indoor pool was fun and it was nice to be able to excersise in the room next to the pool so I could watch the kids. Had breakfast in the restaurant and thought it was a good value. We plan to be back in a few months and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best not the worse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't let the picture on Expedia fool you because this hotel is pretty ugly from the outside. But if you are looking for a semi-comfortable stay at a resoanable price before going back home, this may be for you. In general, the restaurant closed an hour and a half before the actual closing time and the staff was not particularly friendly. The room was clean eventough the water for the morning shower was lukewarm. The air from the vent blew the curtains upwards. My kids did enjoy the indoor pool and the world pool was nice. I would suggest getting a room opposite the airport since there is hardly any noise on that side. The bottom line is if you don't have a lot of money, this is not a bad place

Reviews.Title: “A great Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very nice Airport Hotel. Located across the street from the Airport. Set back about 1/4 block, so there is little or no traffic noise. Also, no noise from the Airport to speak of. The rooms are very clean, the bathrooms the same. The staff friendly. There is a restaurant and bar on site. Free shuttle serivce to and from the airport. For the price, it is great value. I wll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst”
Reviews.Author: nathanf1975
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about staying here. You might as well sleep on a bench at the airport, it would be less hassle. The rooms are ugly and dirty and the service is horrible. We got to our room and the bathroom lights wouldn't work. After talking to the desk person three times, she finally realized that it really wans't working and that maybe I did understand how to operate the lights. She was going to send up a key for a new room but forgot. I had to remind her. Hotels like this don't stay in business long...thank heavens.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a 3 star in my opinion. No heat in bathroom, and the tile floor was cold. The heat/ac unit in bedroom blows the curtain up, and we were on the first floor, this allowed anyone walking by to look into our room. The furnishings were shabby. Even though we had a king room for 2 toilitries were left for only one person. There were no luggage carts to move our suitcases to the room. The phone did not initially work. Need i go on? Find somewhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Clarion Hotel Seattle Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 3000 South 176th Street, Seattle, WA 98188
